bibl.title: Leiffman v. Stein. Memo from Petitioner Attorney
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image.

org.orgName: United States District Court of Washington Territory, Second Judicial District

div1.p: Territory of Washington County of Columbia}
Before Hon S.C. Wingard Judge of Washington Territory for the 1st Judicial Justice at his Chambers in W.T.
The above named Julius Leiffman, Complaining of said Defendant RP Stein Sheriff of Columbia County in said Territory alleges

1st. That the said complement, Julius Leiffman is illegally restrained of his liberty in the County Jail of Columbia County in said Territory by the said Defendant RP Stein Sheriff of said County and keeper of said Jail

2d. That the cause of pretence of the said restraint and imprisonment, according to the best of the knowledge and belief of this complaint, the said Julius Leiffman, is that one Jackson requests the said RP Stein Defendant, as such Sheriff to arrest and hold complement in prison, on the rounds, as alleged by said Jackson, that he, the said Jackson had some papers, documents on authority
